channel.title: Performer on Created by Sam Killermann
channel.description: Recent content in Performer on Created by Sam Killermann

item.title: TEDxTalk: Do the W.O.R.K.
item.description: My third (and final) TEDxTalk, where I present a sort of unified theory of social justice, explaining what it means to “do the work,” and how we can do it. I performed this talk at TEDxYouth in San Diego for the theme “We Can't Wait.” I combined theories from some of my favorite thinkers to create a road map for aspiring social justice advocates. Unfortunately, due to technical difficulties, video from the event didn't make it to TED's site or YouTube.

item.title: TEDxTalk: Understanding the Complexities of Gender
item.description: My second TEDxTalk, disentangling gender identity, expression, and sex in a fun and sometimes-rhyming way.

item.title: TEDxTalk: The Cost of Dreams
item.description: My first TEDxTalk, about the ideas of chasing your dreams, what's at stake, and what we have to lose.

item.title: It's Pronounced Metrosexual
item.description: I wrote the show that became “It's Pronounced Metrosexual” while I was in grad school. It was my “Plan B” for if I don't find a job in higher education. We were still in a recession, and jobs were tough to come by. The online resource aspect of IPM, by about 100-fold the most popular byproduct of the site, was the result of a suggestion by my partner at the time.
